alambusā：alambusā（thī）
အလမ္ဗုသာ（ထီ）
[alaṃ+vasa+a. kāmarativasena devaputte attani vasāpetuṃ alaṃ samatthāti alambusā. ，ṭī.24]
[အလံ+ဝသ+အ။ ကာမရတိဝသေန ဒေဝပုတ္တေ အတ္တနိ ဝသာပေတုံ အလံ သမတ္ထာတိ အလမ္ဗုသာ။ ဓာန်၊ဋီ။၂၄]

Alambusā：The nymph sent by Sakka to tempt the sage Isisinga，as related in the Alambusā Jātaka.

In the present age she was the wife of the monk with reference to whom the Alambusā Jātaka was related （J.v.152-61）.

Her name appears in the Vimānavatthu （p.16，v.10. See also CSB.29，Pl.15） in a list of nymphs who minister with song and dance to Sakka and his queens.
alambusā：Name of a certain apsaras or goddess

alambusā：＂အလမ္ဗုသာ（ထီ）
[အလံ+ဝသ+အ။ ကာမရတိဝသေန ဒေဝပုတ္တေ အတ္တနိ ဝသာပေတုံ အလံ သမတ္ထာတိ အလမ္ဗုသာ။ ဓာန်၊ဋီ။၂၄]
အလမ္ဗုသာ-မည်သော နတ်သမီး။

alambusā：အလမ္ဗုသာ（ဣ）
အလမ္ဗုသာနတ်သမီး။
